--get a quick reference to the tool and handle local Tool = script.Parent local Handle = Tool:WaitForChild("Handle") --a short reference to math.random local R = math.random --this remote receives input events from the client local Remote = Tool:WaitForChild("Remote") --these parts will serve as the basis for some effects local Cube = Instance.new("Part") Cube.FormFactor = "Custom" Cube.Size = Vector3.new(1, 1, 1) Cube.Anchored = true Cube.CanCollide = false Cube.TopSurface = "Smooth" Cube.BottomSurface = "Smooth" Cube.Material = "SmoothPlastic" local Cylinder = Cube:Clone() Instance.new("CylinderMesh", Cylinder) local Sphere = Cube:Clone() Instance.new("SpecialMesh", Sphere).MeshType = "Sphere" --this is a quick reference to heartbeat local Heartbeat = Game:GetService("RunService").Heartbeat --this variable holds our heartbeat connection local Connection --this variable holds the motor so we can destroy it on an unequip local Motor --the following variables affect the behavior of the weapon local CanSwing = true local SwingReload = 1.5 local SwingTimer = 0 local CanDamage = false local DamageAmount = 35 local SwingType = "Normal1"
local NumberCharges = 0 local MaxCharges = 5 local ChargeTimer = 0 local ChargeParts = {}
local JumpAttackVelocity = 120 --this table holds the armor local Armor = {} local EquippingArmor = false
--this function decrements the swing timer if we're unable to swing function handleSwingTimer(dt) if not CanSwing then SwingTimer = SwingTimer - dt if SwingTimer <= 0 then CanSwing = true end end end
--this function handles the graphical consequences of having charges function handleCharges(dt) ChargeTimer = ChargeTimer + dt if NumberCharges > 0 then local theta = ChargeTimer * 4 local thetaStep = (math.pi * 2) / NumberCharges local radius = 2 for index = 1, NumberCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] local dx = math.cos(theta) * radius local dy = math.sin(theta) * radius charge.CFrame = Handle.CFrame:toWorldSpace(CFrame.new(dx, dy, 0)) theta = theta + thetaStep end end end
--this function tags the target for integration of the default leaderboard function tagHuman(human) local val = Instance.new("ObjectValue") val.Name = "creator" val.Value = getPlayer() val.Parent = human game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(val, 1) end
--this functon returns whether or not a table contains a value function contains(t, v) for _, val in pairs(t) do if val == v then return true end end return false end
--this is the main part of the weapon, a central tick function onTick(dt) --first, handle the swing timer handleSwingTimer(dt)
--next, the charge timer handleCharges(dt) end
--this function returns the player of this weapon function getPlayer() local char = Tool.Parent if char then return game:GetService("Players"):GetPlayerFromCharacter(char) end end
--this function converts a weld to a motor for animation function convertWeldToMotor(weld) local m = Instance.new("Motor6D") m.Name = weld.Name m.Part0 = weld.Part0 m.Part1 = weld.Part1 m.C0 = weld.C0 m.C1 = weld.C1
local parent = weld.Parent weld:Destroy() m.Parent = parent
Motor = m end
--welds stuff function weldArmor(part1, part0, c0) local w = Instance.new("Weld") w.Part0 = part0 w.Part1 = part1 w.C0 = c0 w.Parent = w.Part0 end
--puts armor on function armorOn() EquippingArmor = true
armorOff()
local char = Tool.Parent if not char then return end
--armor piece local armor = Cube:Clone() armor.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow") armor.Material = "Marble" armor.Reflectance = 0.5 armor.Anchored = false
--arms local arm = armor:Clone() arm.Size = Vector3.new(1.1, 1.8, 1.1) arm.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Deep orange") local armFame = CFrame.new(0, 0.2, 0)
if char:FindFirstChild("Left Arm") then local larm = arm:Clone() larm.Parent = char weldArmor(larm, char["Left Arm"], armFame) table.insert(Armor, larm) end
if char:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") then local rarm = arm:Clone() rarm.Parent = char weldArmor(rarm, char["Right Arm"], armFame) table.insert(Armor, rarm) end
--torso if char:FindFirstChild("Torso") then local torso = armor:Clone() torso.Parent = char torso.Size = Vector3.new(2.1, 2.1, 1.1) weldArmor(torso, char["Torso"], CFrame.new())
local light = Instance.new("PointLight") light.Color = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow").Color light.Range = 24 light.Brightness = 4 light.Parent = torso
local fire = Instance.new("Fire") fire.Color = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow").Color fire.SecondaryColor = BrickColor.new("New Yeller").Color fire.Parent = torso
table.insert(Armor, torso) end
--legs local leg = armor:Clone() leg.Size = Vector3.new(1.1, 2.1, 1.1) local legFrame = CFrame.new()
if char:FindFirstChild("Left Leg") then local lleg = leg:Clone() lleg.Parent = char weldArmor(lleg, char["Left Leg"], legFrame) table.insert(Armor, lleg) end
if char:FindFirstChild("Right Leg") then local rleg = leg:Clone() rleg.Parent = char weldArmor(rleg, char["Right Leg"], legFrame) table.insert(Armor, rleg) end
EquippingArmor = false end
function armorOff() for _, armor in pairs(Armor) do armor:Destroy() end end
--when we equip, we start up the clock function onEquipped() --prevent reentrancy if EquippingArmor then return end
--make SURE that we unequipped onUnequipped()
--connect the heartbeat Connection = Heartbeat:connect(onTick)
--put the charges into the tool toggleCharges(true)
--armor up! armorOn() playSound("SunFireSound")
--as soon as we can, replace "right grip" with a motor while not Tool.Parent do wait() end while not Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") do wait() end convertWeldToMotor(Tool.Parent["Right Arm"]:WaitForChild("RightGrip")) end
--when we unequip, stop the clock function onUnequipped() if Connection then Connection:disconnect() end
--prevent the motor from causing problems if Motor then Motor:Destroy() end
--put the charges back into nil toggleCharges(false)
--armor down! armorOff() end
--this function plays a sound with a random pitch function playSound(name, pitch) local sound = Handle:FindFirstChild(name) if sound then sound.Pitch = pitch or math.random(90, 110)/100 sound:Play() end end
--when the blade is touched, if we can damage, we deal damage and add a charge function onTouched(part) --if we can't damage, don't bother if not CanDamage then return end
--if the part's parent exists and has a humanoid, damage it if part.Parent and part.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") then --damage the person local human = part.Parent.Humanoid tagHuman(human) human:TakeDamage(DamageAmount) --charge up addCharge() --turn off the damage CanDamage = false --play a sound playSound("HitSound") end end
--this function adds a charge to the blade, handling some math and rendering for us function addCharge() --add a charge, but ensure we don't pass the max NumberCharges = NumberCharges + 1 if NumberCharges > MaxCharges then NumberCharges = MaxCharges end --show off the charges! toggleCharges(true) end
--this function easily toggles charges on or off, as well as refreshing the number of them function toggleCharges(on) if on then toggleCharges(false)
for index = 1, NumberCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] charge.Parent = Tool end else for index = 1, MaxCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] charge.Parent = nil end ChargeTimer = 0 end end
--this function makes a crater function crater(pos, t) local twoPi = math.pi * 2 local thetaStep = twoPi / 12
for theta = thetaStep, twoPi, thetaStep do local length = math.random() * 2.5 local dx = math.cos(theta) * (length / 2) local dz = math.sin(theta) * (length / 2) local d = pos + Vector3.new(dx, 0, dz)
local burn = Cube:Clone() burn.Size = Vector3.new(0.4, 0.2, length) burn.CFrame = CFrame.new(d, pos) burn.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Really black") burn.Parent = workspace game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(burn, t) end end
--this function performs a special jump attack function jumpAttack() if Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart") then local root = Tool.Parent.HumanoidRootPart
if NumberCharges > 1 then root.Velocity = Vector3.new(0, JumpAttackVelocity, 0)
NumberCharges = NumberCharges - 1 toggleCharges(true)
CanSwing = false SwingTimer = 0.65
Remote:FireClient(getPlayer(), "PlayAnimation", "Special", 2.4)
playSound("FireSound", math.random(140, 160)/100) playSound("SunFireSound", math.random(200, 220)/100) else local origin = root.Position local direction = Vector3.new(0, -500, 0) local ray = Ray.new(origin, direction) local part, hitPos = workspace:FindPartOnRay(ray, Tool.Parent) local pos = hitPos + Vector3.new(0, 2.5, 0) local delta = pos - origin root.CFrame = root.CFrame + delta
--sunbeam local beam = Cylinder:Clone() beam.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow") beam.Material = "Marble" beam.Transparency = 0.5 beam.Position = (origin + pos) / 2 beam.Size = Vector3.new(0.5, delta.magnitude, 0.5) beam.Parent = workspace game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(beam, 0.25)
--crater crater(hitPos, 6)
--sound playSound("Explosion")
--charges NumberCharges = NumberCharges - 1 toggleCharges(true)
--calculate damage of explosion local damage = delta.magnitude / 2
--explosion local e = Instance.new("Explosion") e.BlastRadius = 16 e.BlastPressure = 500000 + delta.magnitude * 1000 e.DestroyJointRadiusPercent = 0 e.Position = hitPos local victims = {} e.Hit:connect(function(part, distance) if part.Parent and part.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") and part.Parent ~= Tool.Parent then local human = part.Parent.Humanoid if not contains(victims, human) then tagHuman(human) human:TakeDamage(damage) table.insert(victims, human) end end end) e.Parent = workspace end end end
--this function performs a normal strike with the blade function normalAttack() --if we can't swing, don't bother if not CanSwing then return end
if NumberCharges > 0 then if Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") then if Tool.Parent.Humanoid.Jump then jumpAttack() return end end end
--tell our touched handler we can deal damage CanDamage = true --after a short delay, we can't damage anymore. delay(1, function() CanDamage = false end)
--we can't swing for another bit CanSwing = false SwingTimer = SwingReload
--swing the sword and play a sound! Remote:FireClient(getPlayer(), "PlayAnimation", SwingType) if SwingType == "Normal1" then delay(0.15, function() playSound("SwingSound") playSound("FireSound") end) SwingType = "Normal2" else SwingType = "Normal1" playSound("SwingSound") playSound("FireSound") end end
--this function is called once, right away, in order to prep the sword for use --all events are connected here in order to ensure everything is ready function setUp() --create and store the charges we may need for index = 1, MaxCharges do local charge = Sphere:Clone() charge.Mesh.Scale = Vector3.new(3/4, 3/4, 3/4) charge.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow") charge.Transparency = 0.5 charge.Material = "Marble" ChargeParts[index] = charge end
--connect events Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped) Handle.Touched:connect(onTouched)
--this remote event connection is more complex Remote.OnServerEvent:connect(function(player, func, ...) --if it isn't our player, don't bother if player.Character ~= Tool.Parent then return end
--store the arguments in a table local args = {...}
--start the logic if func == "AttackStarted" then normalAttack() end end) end
setUp()

wait() --our player is usually a nice thing to have local Player = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer --the mouse is handy local Mouse = Player:GetMouse() --we'll want an easy reference to the tool local Tool = script.Parent --this is our way of communicating with the server side of things local Remote = Tool:WaitForChild("Remote") --first, acquire our input source local CAS = game:GetService("ContextActionService") --we'll use this variable later to uniquely identify our context actions local ActionName = "LightReflectionSword"

if inputState == Enum.UserInputState.End then Remote:FireServer("AttackEnded", Mouse.Hit.p) end end
